description.text: Another way to get water is to drop some saplings or leaves into the Centrifugal Separator. It will give you a bit of water, about 1/10th of a bucket. Remember, you can power your machines with the flux capacitor from your emergency supply chest. MAKE SURE YOU DO NOT USE UP ALL OF YOUR SAPLINGS.

longDescription.text: You MUST use the QDS to hand in this task. Click select task, place the QDS, and right click it with the quest book. Placing the QDS next to the Centrifugal Separator with the output set to the appropriate side will work.

description.text: The night is dark and full of terrors. Your chances of survival are low, but you can improve them with some sort of weapon and some protection from attack. For your weapon, you'll need the blade to be bone to start. No other starting material is comparable for weapons.
Weapons
Armor

In case case of crash landing, you were equipped with a basic survival package:
- 16 Shotgun shells
- Saplings
- Fertilizer
- Dried nutrient blocks
Note: Choose this path if you want a challenge. Don't expect to stay alive. Completing this quest disables the easy route quest.
Grab some dust!
Quests are work in progress, especially this one. Here's a check box.

With a furnace up, you can now take your next step. Look by the port engine, the one not currently on fire. Apparently the water reclamation leaked a little and has turned some of the dust to clay. Dig it up and make a crucible. Stick a torch under that and not only can you melt cobble to lava but you can smelt ore dust to ingots, if you provide it with a faucet and a casting table or basin.
Warming up

longDescription.text: You can use the crucible as a mini-smeltery. Shift-right click to place a faucet. It only takes blocks, not dusts or broken pieces of ore. If you've still have lava by the broken engine, you can use that to heat your crucible. Also, you can make casts by pouring gold over stone parts.

description.text: Now that you are stable and able to live somewhat comfortably, it's time to look beyond immediate survival and start planning for your future. For true industrialization, you will need plastic and circuit bords. To start off, you can melt plastic scraps from the cities into plastic sheets.
Next tasks
To build up from nothing, you'll have to have some interesting survival strategies, and unique tools to go with them.

longDescription.text: A crook can give you silkworms from breaking leaves and a hammer can crush stone into gravel and sand.

description.text: Finally sustainable power!
Ender power!
Congrats on slaying those monsters
Dirty Deeds
Done Dirt Cheap

In case case of crash landing, you were equipped with a deluxe survival package:
- Supplies for a sync shell
- 32 Shotgun shells
- Saplings
- Fertilizer
- Choice of sandwich
Note: Choose this for an easier experience. Completing this quest disables the hard route quest.
Grab some dust!
Is it just me or does this planet have a lot of undead hostiles. The lack of any life forms baffle me as to how endless they feel.
Holding out for a hero...

longDescription.text: Because of some hqm limitations, you will have to get the mob drops!

description.text: ...till the end of the night

If you haven't noticed, water is hard to find on this dry planet. If you get desperate enough, you can mix a glass bottle with a dirt block to get some dirty water. Make sure not to use up all your dirt though, you'll need it for growing trees and crops.
Dirty dirt

For your continued survival, you'll need to start farming crops and trees on a larger scale. Neither of those are able to take root in the dust of this planet. However, you can compost organic material in a barrel to make some more dirt for yourself.

longDescription.text: Make a barrel with some planks and a slab, then drop some leaves or saplings into it to start composting it into dirt. Get 4 of them to start and you'll be farming in no time.

description.text: You'll need more power eventually, but making any kind of advanced machinery is difficult and often requires circuit boards. However, you can set up a basic source of power with the same fuel as a furnace.

longDescription.text: A pitiful generator can be powered with furnace fuel, charcoal or coal blocks are a very effective power source. It's slow, and you should upgrade to something better as soon as possible, but it will do for now.

description.text: The harsh reality is that you're stuck on this planet. No amount of obsidian rectangles will let you escape. However, the situation means you can't get some resources (like soul sand) through normal methods.
Spores

longDescription.text: To start, you'll have to sift some sand, probably a lot of sand. Eventually you'll find some mycelium spores. Plant the spores on a piece of dirt and you'll get mycelium.

description.text: Witch Water Infusion

longDescription.text: Placing some mycelium under a barrel full of water will slowly convert it into Witch Water. Put some sand in a barrel of Witch Water and it will turn into soul sand.

description.text: Dirty water may help you in a pinch, but for long term survival, you'll need to purify it. Fire should work nicely. Just drop the dirty water bottle into a furnace, apply some heat, and you'll get some clean, drinkable water.

String mesh can be upgraded to flint mesh to gain higher yields. It can be further upgraded later when you get the resources. You can get flint from sifting gravel, which can be crushed from cobblestone.

Your new crucible can turn leaves into small amounts of water. It works like your Centrifugal Separator, but you only need a torch to power it. It's slow, but it makes investing in some shears early a good idea.
Singular bucket o water
Trading in ten bottles of purified water should allow me to create you something strong.
A finely crafted weapon or tool isn't as easy as strapping some rocks to a stick. In fact, basic tools like that won't work for you at all. You'll have to tinker around a bit.
Worktables

longDescription.text: First, make a part builder and a tinker station. The part builder lets you make parts by combining a pattern and a material. The tinker station lets you assemble parts into tools.

description.text: Handles

longDescription.text: Every tool needs a handle, a wood handle should do the trick. You can make one by putting some wood in the part builder with a pattern.

description.text:
Well, that is a mess. Recover what you can from the ship's supplies, and watch out for that detached engine. The core has been breached and the fuel is leaking.
The replicator has taken some damage but looks just barely functional. Maybe it can provide some bottles and a canteen of water.

longDescription.text: If you are having issues surviving your first night, it may help you to make a trench around the ship. Use that dust from digging that to build a 2 block wall on the inside of the trench. That should keep you safe from everything but spiders. To deal with them, make a small cobblestone overhang when you can afford it.

description.text:
As hot as it is here, it isn't nearly hot enough to cook food. For that, you will need a furnace. Sieve dirt for stones, use the stones to make cobblestone, from that comes a slab furnace. 
If you want to sift faster, you can place sieves next to one another, allowing up to 25 sieves to be used at once. Alternatively, a compressed sieve takes up just one block and can sift compressed dust with a slight reduction in output.

longDescription.text: With eight slabs you can craft a slab furnace! All the functionality of a full furnace with lower costs.

description.text: What this planet lacks in water, it makes up for in metals. If you spend some time sifting the dust, you can make serious progress towards some infrastructure.
The fertilizer in your survival package won't last long. Place the mesh in the sieve and sift some dust to get bonemeal.
Sifting for Bonemeal

longDescription.text: Make sure you plant something in the dirt right away!

description.text: For further industrialization, you'll need to move items, fluids, and energy. Time to set up the plumbing.

You'll need some tools to stay alive out here as well. In Tinkers Construct, bone tools are usually the best at the start, but you could make a different type if you'd like. Wood and stone tools are generally ineffective.
Tools

longDescription.text: You can make a mattock with the axe and adze heads, it will be an essential tool for farming early on. Eventually you may want a pickaxe and some other tools, but farming food is vital for your survival, and the mattock can help mine logs and dust as well.

description.text: Its highly recommended to craft string armor once you get enough string.

Seems like this planet it's full of oil!
With the Gas Lift and some pressure, you can pump up Oil from the dust deeps.
You can use the oil to generate energy with the Compression Dynamo, but later you will need a Refinery to make plastic and most efficient fuels.
